revised_title: Leonard James Spencer: A Pioneering Figure in Mineralogy and Meteorite Studies
tldr: Leonard James Spencer was a distinguished mineralogist and Keeper of Minerals at the British Museum (Natural History) from 1927 to 1935. He made significant contributions to the fields of mineralogy, meteorites, and crystallography, describing numerous new minerals and developing the system of registration, labeling, and cataloging that made the British Museum's mineral collection one of the best-documented and indexed in the world. Spencer also conducted important research on meteorites and their impact on Earth, as well as editing the Mineralogical Magazine for 55 years.
